page.title: 14RECREATION
page.content: I spend the weekends as a voluntary helms man at Bradwell Sailing Centre. Breakfast on Sunday is at 8.15.When I arrive at 8.30 I'm left with stewed tea.Work begins at 9.00.My job is lunch preparation,helping making sandwiches.The course arrive about 10.00,when in waterproofs and life jackets we sort out who's with whom, row them out to their dinghys and go through our personal teaching routines.When the safety boat's ready we sail out of the creek and gather in the collecting area,follow lead boat until lunchtime which is on the beach. During the sail home doing manoeuvres improving basic skills,usually we have water fights.Once on our mooring, everything goes ashore and is sorted out.Lock up-5.30.Into the yacht club before going home.When I arrive home sort myself out and go to bed.
